channel.title: Those chinese autoers
channel.description:
i know were not an antileech community, but im curious about those chinese autoers. do they make their own bot? or do they get it from a major cheating community, like us, fagex, or sythe?
ive heard some chinese have this so called "chinese bot" but im not sure. what do you guys think?

item.title: Those chinese autoers
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You guys have no fucking idea what a racial slur or a offensive racial comment is and it’s pissing me off, asking a fucking question about a country’s people, or what their people may or may not have achieved is not a fucking racist comment, and yes, fucking white people can be victims of racial abuse too.

Read full topic

Nvm i just looked at the post again they posted a thing that makes it into english badly translated english but english none the less[/quote]
u tried google translater or other advanced language tools.

Read full topic

item.title: Those chinese autoers
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Actually, they are not all chinese. Members of this community/Fagex have bought keys for it (who weren’t chinese). Also, if you have seen the bot interface, there is no interaction really involved. By good autoers knowing what they are doing (as in scripting for a good autoer), they mostly never even go on the account. That doesn’t mean they are smart as even a child in America could work with that interface (if it was in English/they knew chinese).

Read full topic

item.title: Those chinese autoers
item.dc:creator: @Tuxy Tuxy
item.description:
@Tuxy wrote:

These people, not to mention they are all Chinese. Are very smart, we shouldn’t discuss them like scum-bags. They are what most of us want to be. Good autoers, they know what they are doing, they do it very well and end up making a profit from playing a simple game.

Read full topic

item.title: Those chinese autoers
item.dc:creator: @mykoma mykoma
item.description:
@mykoma wrote:

fat mustard:

Most of the Chinese level 3’s you see, arn’t bots… They have a massive company where they work. They have up to 6 chars logged in on 1 computer i hear. i think it’s called a gold farm or something. idk maybe im wrong, it’s what i was told last time i posted a topic like this.

Yes and most of them are at fish guild fishing sharks all day. If you’re lucky you might get great conversations from them, but most of the time they don’t reply.

Read full topic

item.title: Those chinese autoers
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

It’s name is RS-Demon, there is a thread (which i can’t find right now) about it. Here is one website for it: http://www.pythonabc.php0h.com/. Also there was one before named R-Bot… it might be the same I don’t remember.
EDIT
Found the thread, its http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,114772.msg1136063.html#msg1136063, although a lot of that information is also spread over other threads.
UPDATE
Just to let you know, it costs $2/600k A week for CDkey per character… If you think about it, you see say 50ish per world… (free worlds and not all worlds). Now, Each one of those renews every week… say 10 get banned a week, and 2.00 USD = 15.4532 CNY, and there are 72 free worlds (say 60 get used), but remember 10 more replace the old ones too, so 50 x 2 x 60 x 52 (and this goes on all year) he makes 312,000 a year (at that static formula which is probably off) he would be making 312,000.00 USD = 2,410,643.04 CNY, and if over there an item worth one CNY is used like one USD (e.g. a pack of gum or something [although its probably not]) and (factoring in communism [W00T REDS!!!]) he might just be freakin rich [by their standards].
nother update…
Fixed up the formula best i can.

Read full topic

like u said killermopar they prolly downloaded the sourcecode and xlated it into english etc
